Description: Rim and body fragment (mended from two sherds) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior: glazed with three bands of added red lined in white; exterior, cream slip: tongues at rim; animal frieze below: swan to left amid much floral and other filling ornament: pendant rosettes, large palmette and swastika; red patches on neck, breast and alternate feathers of swan, on alternate petals of palmette, and every fourth tongue; below, stopt maeander band between bands with superimposed red bands lined in white; minor part of further frieze below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D p. 80 and pl. IV, 37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.182)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
